channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Developing pothole , material being expelled on pavement, 8th February
item.description:
Outside 6 Branch Hill Rise (there are others but this needs attention) Inner ballast exposed and road material being thrown onto pavement by passage of cars.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Branch Hill Rise, Cheltenham

item.title: I counted fourteen potholes on Wellington Road between the suare and the A435, 8th February
item.description:
It's becoming dangerous to drive on this dreadful bit of Road. It is used far more than in the past because of the foolish closure of Central Cross Drive due to the cycle path which means it takes all school traffic. There are about 3 of the 14 with flaky white paint around them
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, Wellington Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 4 large pot holes, on narrow chicane outside school that are impossible to avoid, 8th February
item.description:
There are 4 large pot holes in Albert Road, outside Pittville School, where the road narrows into a single lane. It is impossible for drivers to avoid the 4 pot holes (due to the nature of their position) and over the past weeks they have become much deeper and more dangerous to all road users. Yesterday, Saturday 7th January 2026, as we hit one of the pot holes it caused the car to jerk and hit the kerb, resulting in a puncture in the passenger side front wheel. Upon examination the front rim of the wheel is also now badly scratched. See photos.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albert Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
